    A

    addPiece(int[][], int, int) - Method in class logic.GravityHandler

    C

    checkForWin(int[][]) - Method in class logic.BoardHandler
    checks if there are 4 same-player pieces in a row and gives a true-or-false return
    checkInRange(int) - Method in class logic.InputHandler
    Checks if user's indicated column is within the range of columns available for a given game The range is from 1 to the amount of columns, inclusive, as that
    Circle - Class in ui
    Circle.java creates the checkers for player1 (red) and player2 (blue)

    D

    deepCopy(int[][]) - Method in class logic.ArrayHandler
    Method to copy a 2d array iteratively, one array at a time.
    dump() - Method in class logic.BoardHandler
    debugging method for dumping both boards and seeing if back-end is entering pieces into the right positions

    E

    evalBoard(int[][]) - Method in class logic.BoardHandler
    evaluates and gives a total score for the entire board situation

    F

    findBestMove(int[][]) - Method in class logic.BoardHandler
    Iterates through placing a piece in each column and calling upon evalBoard() to rate the position
    findLowest(int[][], int) - Method in class logic.GravityHandler
    Finds the index of the lowest available slot in a given column for a given board

    GravityHandler - Class in logic
    Handles any board/pieces interactions to do with gravity It makes sure all pieces are at the bottommost positions and has checks for if a column is filled (from gravity)
    GravityHandler() - Constructor for class logic.GravityHandler

    N

    nextMove(int) - Method in class logic.BoardHandler
    analyzes a board through method findBestMove and returns its output, which is the best move for that current board position
